column1: Bosscat Kitchen & Libations////Got the bosscat burger "chef's way" and it wasn't bad. The patty wasn't greasy
column2: but it crumbles when you bite into it. It's interesting how they use cheese that you can tell is real
column5: processed stuff. The toasted bun was really good and the other ingredients made this burger taste fresh (for a lack of a better word). It's definitely not the taste of typical greasy American burger
column6: so I have mixed feelings about it. Not sure if it's worth $16 without fries.
